entries.title: WATCH: Ashli Babbitt's Mom Arrested Outside Capitol For Protesting Daughter's Death
entries.description:
As we all know, today is the two-year anniversary of the darkest day in our nation's history. That fateful day when "that" Shaman burst into the Speaker's Chamber altered the course of history forever.

Though the media prefers to skirt over this detail, the only person killed in the Capitol on January 6th, 2021, was 35-year-old Air Force veteran Ashli Babbitt. Ashli was shot by Capitol Officer Michael Byrd as she was climbing through a broken window into the Speaker's Lobby. Byrd defended shooting Babbitt during an interview with NBC, saying he was doing his job and that Ashli was a threat to lawmakers.

\u201cLieutenant Michael Byrd confirms to NBC News that he shot and killed Ashli Babbitt. \n\nByrd defends his actions by saying, \u201cI know that day I saved countless lives.\u201d\n\nByrd also credited his training.\n\nByrd left his gun unattended in the bathroom back in 2019.\n\nBabbitt was unarmed.\u201d
— Breanna Morello (@Breanna Morello) 1630018818


\u201cThe @January6thCmte hasn\u2019t mentioned Ashli Babbitt, who was shot and killed in the Capitol a single time during these hearings\u2026\n\nI wonder why? \n\n\u201d
— Tayler Hansen (@Tayler Hansen) 1655855643

Earlier today, Ashli Babbitt's mother, Micki Witthoeft, attempted to protest Ashli's death outside of the Capitol. She was promptly taken into custody by police, reportedly for jaywalking.

\u201c\ud83d\udea8Executed veteran Ashli Babbit\u2019s mother arrested outside U.S. Capitol for protesting her daughter\u2019s murder by Capitol cop Michael Byrd. Alleged charge was the never-enforced \u201cjaywalking\u201d.\u201d
— Raheem J. Kassam (@Raheem J. Kassam) 1673033943

Micki had been standing with protestors who had signs that read "Jesus is Lord" and "Kevin Greeson, murdered by Capitol Police." Kevin Greeson was a protestor who also died at the Capitol on January 6th. USA Today reported Greeson died of a heart attack after accidentally tazing himself in the testicles.

However, investigative journalist Tayler Hansen, who was at the Capitol on January 6th, says Greeson actually had a medical emergency after a concussion grenade was thrown by Capitol Police.

\u201cFor over an hour this went on, during this barrage Kevin Greeson and Benjamin Phillips both suffered fatal heart attacks from the munitions being thrown. (Munitions we\u2019re not authorized to be used on the 6th)\n\nPeople were on fire and had holes blown in them at this point.\u201d
— Tayler Hansen (@Tayler Hansen) 1673021584

Three other people died at the Capitol that day: Benjamin Phillips, Roseanne Boyland, and Officer Brian Sicknick. Media reports claim Phillips died of a medical emergency and Boyland was trampled to death. Hansen's reporting found that Phillips was also struck by a concussion grenade, which he says caused his heart attack. Videos have emerged depicting Boyland being beaten unconscious by a Capitol Police Officer. And media originally reported Officer Sicknick was beaten with a fire extinguisher, then killed by bear spray, before it was ruled he died of natural causes.

\u201cCapitol Police officer Brian D. Sicknick, who engaged rioters, suffered two strokes and died of natural causes, officials say https://t.co/jgJ3VdcmLY\u201d
— The Washington Post (@The Washington Post) 1618861750

Videos have emerged depicting Boyland being beaten unconscious by a Capitol Police Officer. And media originally reported Officer Sicknick was beaten with a fire extinguisher, then killed by bear spray, before it was ruled he died of natural causes.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: WATCH: White woman claims traffic is racist, because of course she does
entries.description:
It's always fun to wake up and see what completely normal inconvenience has now been branded by the left as racist and something to be very, VERY angry about. Today, it's traffic in Atlanta.

This completely happy and mentally stable individual took to TikTok to explain why:

\u201c\ud83e\udd21\u201d
— Clown World \u2122 \ud83e\udd21 (@Clown World \u2122 \ud83e\udd21) 1672890062

Though this chick is insufferable to listen to, parts of what she is saying are true. Highways built in the 50s often ran through poorer neighborhoods because people with higher-value property and taxes didn't want a highway in their front yards. And poorer neighborhoods/inner cities were predominantly black.

But what exactly is the purpose of being angry about it now? I think everyone's blood pressure is high enough as it is sitting in hours of traffic. Plus, racist road-building isn't required for traffic to be bad in cities. That's pretty much a given, no matter how seriously a city took the Civil Rights Movement. The #1 worst city for traffic in the U.S. is Los Angeles, which doesn't have nearly the same history regarding race as Atlanta.

Just for laughs, here are a few other things that have recently been labeled "racist" by the left:

1. Losing weight, unless you also support "fat liberation." Could that mean liberating fat from one's body? If so, count me in!

\u201cLosing weight, even if it\u2019s for your health is fatphobic- unless you\u2019re also a fat liberation activist\u201d
— Libs of TikTok (@Libs of TikTok) 1672688412

2. Not supporting wearing masks until the end of time. Somehow this one's rooted in white supremacy.

\u201cThe New Yorker wrote an article arguing we should wear masks forever and noted you're a racist if you disagree \ud83e\udd23\ud83e\udd21 https://t.co/73v0HCbwL1\u201d
— Not the Bee (@Not the Bee) 1672327929

3. Shark Week, which apparently doesn't diversify its shark selection. The real question is, what does The Washington Post have against men named Mike?

\u201cI thought this was satire. It\u2019s not. \nThis is what \u201cacademic research\u201d is too often about. \n\n\u2018Shark Week\u2019 lacks diversity, overrepresents men named Mike, scientists say https://t.co/QvDqJmVfce\u201d
— Brian Lilley (@Brian Lilley) 1670363912

4. Writing and grammar. This is strange because I swore I remembered a time when great Abolitionists fought for their children to be able to learn to read and write...must've just been a crazy fever dream.

\u201cEnglish teacher says that grammar and writing rules are based in white supremacy so she tries to undermine it in her classroom\u201d
— Libs of TikTok (@Libs of TikTok) 1670177538

5. And finally, Daylight Savings Time.

\u201cCNN now claiming Daylight Savings Time is racist. https://t.co/w82awxuAre\u201d
— Brick Suit (@Brick Suit) 1669407936

To be honest, this is one I can get behind. If anyone can get something canceled, it's the rabid, virtue-signaling left. And Daylight Savings Time is stupid AF.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Watch: Based dude explains real reason for announcing 'your pronouns' with basic grammar lesson
entries.description:
The left's obsession with controlling language and compelling thought through pronouns has reached the point of absurdity. Like, having time added to your prison sentence over calling a he a she level absurdity. As Elon Musk tweeted, forcing your pronouns upon others when they didn’t ask, and implicitly ostracizing those who don’t, is neither good nor kind to anyone. But I've never quite heard the insanity explained better than through this random TikToker.

Maybe it's the British accent. If it was an Irish accent, he would sound drunk. If it were a Scottish accent he would sound like he was looking for someone to beat the humus out of. But the British accent makes this basic grammar lesson sound intellectual as f*ck.

Based man explains the real reason why a person might want to announce what his or her pronouns are.

His explanation is perfect. pic.twitter.com/CJ8jmHSZxU
— Catch Up (@CatchUpNetwork) January 6, 2023

When you are having a conversation with someone, you aren't referring to them with third-person pronouns like he/her, xi/xir, or frog/frogself. You're referring to them with second-person pronouns like you and yours. Using third-person pronouns in a conversation with someone makes you sound metal, daft, and like a nutter.

So when you -- quite uninvited -- declare your pronouns to me, in spite of what you might say, you are not telling me how to address you. You are not telling me how you like to be spoken to. What you're telling me is how I must think about you and how I must speak to everyone else in the world when I refer to you. You might think it's okay to control me in that way. You may think you have a good justification for doing so. But at the very least let's be honest about what you're doing. Because that's how I like to be spoken to.

What sells it is ending the video with a spot of tea.

Brilliant explanation, lad. More importantly, sick mohawk.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Oregon suspect claims man was a robot, so he NATURALLY had to chew "the robot's" face off
entries.description:
Oregon having a normal one! If it weren't such a beautiful state, I would probably believe it to be completely forsaken by God at this point.

Case in point: twenty-five-year-old Koryn Kraemer was recently accused of biting off an elderly man's ear and chewing his face at a train platform in a suburb of Portland.

You would think that story cannot possibly get worse. I would remind you that it is 2023, meaning, of course, it can.

Kraemer told authorities he believed the victim was a robot because of how he smelled. So of course his natural reaction, as a human defending all of humanity from the coming android takeover, was to bite off the robot's face and reveal the machinery underneath.

Unfortunately, the man was not, in fact, a robot, and police said his wounds were so bad that his skull was visible.

\u201cEarly this morning, an elderly man in the #Portland area was violently attacked at the Cleveland Ave. train station in Gresham. The suspect chewed off half the man's face. First responders could see the victim's skull. A 25-year-old suspect was arrested. https://t.co/k1VoEGV9JI\u201d
— Andy Ng\u00f4 \ud83c\udff3\ufe0f\u200d\ud83c\udf08 (@Andy Ng\u00f4 \ud83c\udff3\ufe0f\u200d\ud83c\udf08) 1672801967

Kraemer did at least have the decency to thank the responding officers for saving him from the robot. He also admitted to using marijuana, fentanyl, and alcohol just before the attack.

Portland's train system could soon rival New York City's for the worst public transportation system in the country. Just a few weeks ago, a homeless woman pushed a 3-year-old child onto the tracks. Luckily, the child was quickly rescued.

\u201cShare this now everyone needs to see this\u201d
— Wtfportland (@Wtfportland) 1672365867

The homeless woman had a significant criminal record, including a felony for heroin possession, and one incident where she stabbed a man after he invited her inside for breakfast.

Oregon recently "reformed" its bail system to focus on "flight risk" and "danger to the community" as opposed to whether or not the arrested individual can pay bail. The new law also orders that some defendants are released without bail entirely, depending on the crime.

\u201c\u201cIt\u2019s a piece of cake\u2026you get three meals a day and don\u2019t have to do shit\u2026wake up, eat get high, wake up eat get high\u201d repeat. A homeless woman shared with me why it\u2019s so easy to be homeless. She was brutally honest because she hates the enablement \u201cThey are loving us to death\u201d\u201d
— Kevin Dahlgren (@Kevin Dahlgren) 1672522221

Plus, homelessness is significantly driving up crime in Portland. The government makes it easy with three meals a day, zero cops, and a lack of drug laws, as resident homeless person Wendy told a reporter last week.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: 20000 pounds of fentanyl? Biden drops an obscene number of gaffes in a single speech
entries.description:
I'm not sure if we can keep blaming all these Biden mishaps on his alleged (according to critics) dementia anymore. I mean, it's always been known that Biden isn't exactly the sharpest tool in the shed. But yesterday was a truly remarkable day for Biden's stupidity.

First and foremost, he claimed that "20,000 pounds of fentanyl is enough to kill 1,000 people."

Mr. President, that amount of fentanyl would nuke the planet.

\u201cBiden: \u201c20,000 lbs of fentanyl is enough to kill 1,000 people in this country.\u201d\n\nThat would be enough fentanyl to kill nearly everyone on the planet. \n\u201d
— Greg Price (@Greg Price) 1672939894

Next, Biden claimed that no Central Americans suddenly decide to sell all their belongings, entrust their lives to a Coyote, and embark on an extremely dangerous journey to illegally cross into America though they don't know the language and have nothing but the clothes on their backs, and therefore become entirely dependent on the American government and taxpayers. That would just be lunacy!

\u201cBiden: "It's not like people are sitting around a table somewhere in Central America saying 'I got a great idea. Let's sell everything we have. Let's give it to a Coyote or smuggler. They'll take us on a harrowing journey. Then we're gonna illegally cross the border."\u201d
— Greg Price (@Greg Price) 1672938776

What's his source for this information, you may ask? Well, he explained that no one knows more about the border than the strange woman lurking in the background...who hasn't been to the border since June of 2021.

\u201cBiden: "Nobody knows [the challenges at the border] better than the Vice President."\u201d
— Greg Price (@Greg Price) 1672937956

But wait! After two years, Biden FINALLY proposed a plan to solve the border crisis.

Its...an app...to allow illegal immigrants to seek asylum.

\u201cBiden announces a new plan to stop the surge of illegal border crossings: An "app" that migrants can use to seek asylum in America.\u201d
— Greg Price (@Greg Price) 1672938330

Now, I must admit, I am a bit intrigued. Will there be an Asylum test on the app? Will they have to perform a TikTok dance to prove they are true American patriots? Or perhaps pledge allegiance to Ukraine? I need answers.

Biden was also asked by a reporter about the drama over Kevin McCarthy's struggle to attain 218 votes in the Speaker's race. When asked if he was following the race, Biden struggled to come up with a simple response, until his handler-I mean, Vice President- stepped in.

\u201cReporter: "Are you still monitoring the Speaker's race?"\n\nBiden: "I'm following with great... uhh... How do I say it?"\n\nKamala: "Attention."\n\nBiden: "Attention."\u201d
— Greg Price (@Greg Price) 1672939535

And finally, he once again referred to Kamala Harris as "President."

\u201cBiden calls Kamala "President Harris" again.\u201d
— Greg Price (@Greg Price) 1672938564

At this point, I think it's safe to say this is not actually a gaffe. In fact, this may be the only issue where Biden has been honest with the American people.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: 'Don't tell the moron community': Tucker Carlson barbeques liberal media's overreaction to Kevin McCarthy drama
entries.description:
Congress is scheduled to gavel in at noon. Allegedly, Kevin McCarthy has a deal in place. No word on if there still isn't a Speaker after twelve rounds, that it goes to the judges' scorecard for decision. Or if McCarthy loses five more times he gets first pick in the 2023 draft. However, by the time you are reading this, Kevin McCarthy *may* be the Speaker of the House and corporate media can calm down a bit.

Because as Tucker Carlson points out, dear God you people are ridiculous.

"This is what democracy looks like when you get up close... how is that a disaster?"

"It’s not a disaster. It’s how that system is supposed to work."

Tucker Carlson with a refreshing dose of sanity over McCarthy's struggle to become Speaker. pic.twitter.com/3qmd0xXDrg
— Kyle Becker (@kylenabecker) January 6, 2023
None of it qualifies as especially unusual, or even bad. This is what democracy looks like when you get up close. You want one thing, I want another thing, let's schedule a vote. Or, eleven votes. How is that a disaster? It's not a disaster. It's how the system is supposed to work. But don't tell the moron community that.

I'm going to need a moment now that "moron community" has been introduced to the lexicon.

My personal favorite was CNN comparing the Damar Hamlin injury to GOP dysfunction. There isn't a big enough bag of dicks left in Brian Stelter's old office for them to choke on for that one.

For all the drama and all the dumb attacks made, there is an above-average chance we end Friday with a Speaker of the House. The Republic will continue. And 97% of Americans will have been too busy living their lives to know our country went forty-eight hours without a Speaker of the House.

The only difference will be a group of congressmen got the much-needed changes to the institution they were looking for. This isn't life or death. It's only politics.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Country superstar Parker McCollum comes out HARD in support of freedom, gun rights
entries.description:
Anyone who knows me knows I have three loves in life: my nieces and nephew, pro wrestling, and country music. It's a love of music in general, but I've gone hard on a Texas country kick as of late. So it was delightful to wake up this morning and read one of my favorite artists, Parker McCollum, is based as f*ck.

McCollum sat down with NRA Country to discuss his love of hunting. And this response to a question about what freedom and the second amendment mean to him is awesome.

Freedom to me is the ability to think and decide for yourself, to live the kind of life you want to live. And I think it’s so important at the very start of this country they put that amendment into place to allow citizens to protect themselves from a tyrannical government. I know it seems old-school like that was a long time ago, but with the crazy world we are living in today, it seems more relevant and necessary than ever.

Hell yeah, brother!

Because it’s the middle of the week and we can all use an unreleased Parker McCollum cut on our lunch break… pic.twitter.com/Ph0PlTi9nZ
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) November 2, 2022

True, it's less risky for country artists to come out in support of things like freedom and gun rights. The country music fanbase is known for still believing in things like, you know, America. But it's not like the corporate woke entertainment side of things hasn't crept into the industry as of late. McCollum is one of the top stars on the rise. Even sitting down with the NRA is nice to see.

McCollum will be hitting the road as part of Morgan Wallen's 2023 stadium tour. I'm sure there will be plenty of hunting and new music before then.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Conservatives fight for your right to crush beers before the College Football Championship, blast "no tailgating" rule
entries.description:
America was shook this week. No, not the nonsense over the Speaker of the House. Ain't nobody got time for that. The National Championship is this Monday in Los Angeles between the Georgia Bulldogs and the TCU Horned Frogs. And fans in attendance will NOT be allowed to tailgate before the game. It's one of the most unAmerican decisions you can think of. Did I mention the game was being played in California?

I admit to not following college football that much and prefer the grown-ups (go Bills). But it's every American's God-given right to tailgate before sporting events, concerts, little league games, dance recitals...basically if there is a parking lot our red Solo cups should be filled. Not at SoFi stadium. Even worse, we can't blame the usual California politicians.

Tailgating will not be allowed on-site before the game between the Georgia Bulldogs and TCU Horned Frogs, according to the SoFi Stadium website. It appears that the directive is coming from the College Football Playoff.

Right. "Appears."

Unamused by this is Georgia Governor and signer of common sense voter-integrity reform Brian Kemp.

While California may not know this, in the South a tailgate with friends & family is the only way to prepare for a big game. When Georgia hosts the 2025 #NationalChampionship , we'll make sure fans are able to tailgate! Even if it's at the state Capitol!!https://t.co/IHw22tZE6U
— Governor Brian P. Kemp (@GovKemp) January 5, 2023

Local Bulldogs fan and youth football coaching legend @3YearLetterman is lobbying to pass the Gerald R. Ford Right to Tailgate Act of 2023. The bill states Congress will make no law abridging the Right to Tailgate, no group of people will be denied their right to gather before a sporting event and get sh*tfaced, and Putin has zero SEC championships. That last bit isn't a "law" but it needs to be resoluted.

His patriotic views on how much soccer sucks aside, @3YearLetterman is apolitical and is lobbying for bipartisan support for his legislation. It just so happens the first two sponsors are conservative stalwarts. Horned Frogs fan Sen. Ted Cruz.

I am happy to cosponsor this important legislation. https://t.co/EzZ2YZzsyu
— Ted Cruz (@tedcruz) January 5, 2023

And University of Georiga alumni Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene.

As an UGA alumni & proud Dawg fan, I stand in support of football fans right to tailgate.

Tailgating is an essential part of football and tradition.

In these trying times, we must fight for everything sacred & remember to have fun;)

Alas without a Speaker, we are powerless.. pic.twitter.com/6axTT3saDq
— Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene🇺🇸 (@RepMTG) January 5, 2023

As of this writing, it is unclear if the Gerald R. Ford Right to Tailgate Act of 2023 is part of the deal Kevin McCarthy cut with his opposition. Today would be the last day to vote on this important legislation. If it isn't included, it's the final straw, and McCarthy shouldn't be allowed anywhere near the Speaker of the House's fancy chair.

He's a California politician. The no-tailgating game is in California. Just sayin'.

Editor’s Note

entries.title: Eureka! Kevin McCarthy cuts deal with rebels and we might have a Speaker of the House today
entries.description:
News is breaking this morning that Kevin McCarthy has cut a deal with the rebels. Presumably, this means a vote today with Kevin McCarthy being elected Speaker of the House. Which, let's be honest, was the way this was always going to end. It is what it is. McCarthy's only job should be to say no to democrats and otherwise keep quiet.

This is a breaking news story and we'll be updating this post as more information becomes available. Or at the very least interesting.

HOUSE REPUBLICANS will hold a conference call tomorrow morning to walk through the deal Team McCarthy has cut with his opposition.

Important note: This is a phone call not an in-person meeting. Calls are much easier for leadership to manage.
— Jake Sherman (@JakeSherman) January 6, 2023

My belief is a deal was cut judging by the number of last-minute fundraising appeals I've seen from rebel members. Gotta get that bag before it's too late!

Still no word on what's in the deal. But, allegedly, Matt Gaetz was telling people they got all they wanted. Also allegedly, he said this to Rep. Ilhan Omar. As opposed to Rep. AOC who, according to a lip-reading expert, he talked about shrubbery.

Rep. Matt Gaetz had been making the rounds on the D side today talking to members. He told Rep. Omar the anti-Kevin group got all they wanted but still weren’t voting for him yet, per source familiar

Photo cred to Getty/Win McNamee pic.twitter.com/KOV3FVLlXv
— Nicholas Wu (@nicholaswu12) January 6, 2023

What's in the deal is unknown. However, if the rebels ONLY got Chip Roy's rule changes that will allow amendments to bills and Gaetz's rule that bills should include only one subject, all this drama was worth it. Those two things alone will make a YUGE difference for the American people. Even if both changes are too subtle for most apolitical people to realize. Especially when corporate media, instead of reporting things accurately, overhypes everything that happens as literal life or death.

Any demands the rebels get on top are a bonus. Everyone is happy. The rebels get their changes and to prove their point. Kevin McCarthy gets to tell people he is the Speaker of the House.

Editor’s Note
